issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Cost to choose side table in MapJoin conversion based on cumulative cardinality

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Physical Optimizer
components.description: Optimizations which are dependent on runtime

fields.description:
Selection of side table (in memory/hash table) in MapJoin Conversion algorithm needs to be more sophisticated.

In an N way Map Join, Hive should pick an input stream as side table (in memory table) that has least cost in producing relation (like TS(FIL|Proj)*).

Cost based choice needs extended cost model; without return path its going to be hard to do this.

For the time being we could employ a modified cost based algorithm for side table selection.

New algorithm is described below:
1. Identify the candidate set of inputs for side table (in memory/hash table) from the inputs (based on conditional task size)
2. For each of the input identify its cost, memory requirement. Cost is 1 for each heavy weight relation op (Join, GB, PTF/Windowing, TF, etc.). Cost for an input is the total no of heavy weight ops in its branch.
3. Order set from #1 on cost & memory req (ascending order)
4. Pick the first element from #3 as the side table.
fields.summary: Extend logic to choose side table in MapJoin Conversion algorithm

ATTACHMENT ID: 12765374 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~jpullokkaran], thanks for the comments.

The new patch implements getNumberOfCostlyOps by leveraging the methods in OperatorUtils; using GraphWalker seems an overkill.
As we discussed, patch could reuse OperatorUtils.classifyOperators to for counting no of ops of certain type.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12765805 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~jcamachorodriguez] Looked at latest patch, comments are below:
1. ConvertJoinMapJoin.getMapJoinConversionPos: If for any relation inputSize > maxSize (i.e noconditionaltask.size) then this optimization shouldn't apply even if the costly ops comparison is not favorable. 
2. ConvertJoinMapJoin.COSTLY_OPERATORS: Instead of listing all of the join sub classes could we use "CommonJoinOperator"
3. OperatorUtils.iterateParentsExcludingCurrent: This is not used and could be removed.

#1 If a relation has input size > maxSize (i.e it can not be kept in memory) then we shouldn't use costlyops comparison. Instead that relation should be chosen as streaming side.
The check in Line 581 could prevent an input that has lower costlyops but whose size > maxis from becoming streaming side.

      if (bigInputNumberCostlyOps == -1 || inputNumberCostlyOps > bigInputNumberCostlyOps
              || (inputNumberCostlyOps == bigInputNumberCostlyOps && inputSize > bigInputStat.getDataSize())) {
